Component: Unfortunately, Russia has not stopped there, and apparently its leaders are now targeting other parts of Ukraine and brazenly interfering in its internal affairs.
Label: claim

Component: In order to implement the Geneva statement for the de-escalation of the situation in the eastern regions of Ukraine, the Government of Ukraine immediately took the necessary practical steps.
Label: claim

Component: Within just one week, the Government suspended the active phase of its anti-terrorist operation, whose main objective was the restoration of law and order and the protection of civilians.
Label: premise

Component: It initiated constitutional reform.
Label: premise

Component: It approved the concept of local administrative reform, whose main principles are decentralizing power in the country, significantly empowering local communities and improving management at the regional and district levels
Label: premise

Component: A draft law on amnesty for participants in the uprisings in the eastern regions has been prepared and would apply to those protesters who surrender their weapons and evacuate illegally seized administrative buildings, except for those suspected of committing serious crimes.
Label: premise

Component: The parliamentary coalition has invited all political parties represented in the Ukrainian Parliament to sign a memorandum of understanding on ways to resolve the situation in eastern Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: The Minister of Internal Affairs and Security Services has continued implementing a nationwide campaign to seize illegal arms from the population, and more than 6,000 weapons have been handed over recently.
Label: premise

Component: Ukraine is demonstrating its commitment to constructive cooperation with human-rights institutions and international organizations.
Label: claim

Component: What has Russia done for its part of the Geneva document?
Label: claim

Component: It has done nothing.
Label: claim

Component: Because of the lack of support for the separatists among the population of eastern Ukraine, Russia is seeking new ways to destabilize the situation in the region, preparing and carrying out numerous armed provocations through its agents.
Label: premise

Component: Russian-sponsored illegal paramilitary units have continued to destabilize the situation in eastern Ukraine, preparing the ground for a new stage of military aggression.
Label: premise

Component: The Russian leadership has done nothing to publicly dissociate itself from the armed separatists and provocateurs or to urge them to immediately lay down their arms and release captured administrative buildings.
Label: premise

Component: Russia has not even condemned the seizure of hostages, including journalists, or separatists' open acts of xenophobia and anti-Semitism.
Label: premise

Component: Any attempts by Russia to show that the Ukrainian Government is trying to use force against the peaceful Ukrainian population are lies.
Label: claim

Component: Our Government respects freedom of expression and the right to peaceful assembly, which are guaranteed by the Constitution of Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: However, when heavily armed, professionally trained groups led by Russian military seize law-enforcement facilities and administrative offices, kill Ukrainian police officers and take hostages,
Label: premise

Component: they are operating like terrorists and must be treated accordingly.
Label: claim

Component: Ukrainian counter-terrorism operations are targeted exclusively at illegal armed groups threatening civilians.
Label: claim

Component: Meanwhile, the Russian-controlled army groups are in fact holding the entire civilian population of several towns in the eastern region hostage and have thus transgressed the bounds of humanity.
Label: claim

Component: Three Ukrainian law-enforcement officers were abducted, brutally beaten, tortured and later presented to the Russian media as Ukrainian spies, blindfolded and with their hands tied.
Label: premise

Component: Ukrainian and foreign journalists are being systematically kidnapped, while Russian journalists are allowed to operate in the areas controlled by the illegal armed groups.
Label: premise

Component: A military helicopter was destroyed with a man-portable air defence (MANPAD) guided missile.
Label: premise

Component: It should be understood that peaceful protesters cannot buy MANPADs in shops.
Label: premise

Component: Representatives of the military verification mission of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) were taken hostage in Sloviansk.
Label: premise

Component: The detention by force of international observers is yet another testament to the criminal and terrorist nature of the separatist armed groups.
Label: premise

Component: In contrast to the demand voiced in many of the statements in the Council today that those hostages be released, the Russian Federation, as might be expected, made no such demand; nor have its leaders in Moscow.
Label: claim

Component: What is important is that the leaders of the illegal armed groups have publicly admitted responsibility for all the aforementioned crimes * even on television.
Label: premise

Component: Many members of the illegal militant groups are citizens of the Russian Federation, and they are not even trying to hide it, publicly displaying their identification.
Label: premise

Component: We recently read an article in The New York Times in which the Kuban Cossack Mozhaev declared his presence and that of an armed group from his region, which we had noticed in Crimea as well.
Label: premise

Component: Ukrainian law-enforcement agencies have credible evidence of these persons' involvement in serious crimes.
Label: premise

Component: Today, some ofthose crimes have been described.
Label: premise

Component: Among them was the brutal story of Volodymyr Rybak, a member of Horlivka's City Council, and Yuriy Popravko, a l9-year-old activist from Kyiv, who were martyred by members of terrorist groups.
Label: premise

Component: Their bodies, mutilated by torture, were found in the Torets River in the vicinity of Sloviansk.
Label: premise

Component: Volodymyr Rybak disappeared on 17 April in Horlivka after he tried to remove the separatists' flag from the building of Horlivka City Council.
Label: premise

Component: A video of the kidnapping, as well as audio recordings of phone conversations intercepted by Ukraine's Security Service, provided sufficient proof that terrorist leaders, notably the self-proclaimed mayor of Sloviansk, Vyacheslav Ponomaryov, and the military commander of the terrorists, the Russian agent Igor Strelkov, were involved in the murder.
Label: premise

Component: The true identity of the Russian agent has been established as Colonel Igor Girkin of Russian military intelligence, who is registered as a permanent resident of Moscow.
Label: premise

Component: The Government of Ukraine strongly condemns the aforementioned acts of terror and violence, including yesterday's attempt to assassinate the Mayor of Kharkiv, Hennadiy Kernes, who publicly supported the unity and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: President Putin now openly admits the use of Russian military forces and praises them for their heroism and the successful completion of the operation aimed at the reunification of Crimea with Russia.
Label: claim

Component: They have even issued a special medal of honour.
Label: premise

Component: And now, in spite of numerous irrefutable facts concerning Russian military involvement in organizing and guiding illegal armed groups in eastern Ukraine, Moscow denies any Russian military participation just as hard.
Label: claim

Component: Furthermore, Russia is now threatenting to use force, as demonstrated by its concentration of armed forces directly on the eastern border of our country.
Label: claim

Component: The number of units along Ukraine's borders has increased.
Label: premise

Component: Last week, we all heard intensified militaristic rhetoric from senior Russian officials, including President Putin, Minister Lavrov and Minister Shoigu, threatening to send Russian troops into the territory of Ukrain under various pretexts.
Label: premise

Component: Defence Minister Shoigu reported the start of new military exercises by battalion tactical groups from the southern and western military districts of the Russian armed forces in connection with "the deteriorating situation in southeastern Ukraine".
Label: premise

Component: the withdrawal of troops announced by Minister Shoigu yesterday has not come true.
Label: claim

Component: We still observe those troops near our borders.
Label: premise

Component: Let me remind him that Ukraine has never threatened Russia, and never will.
Label: claim

Component: Ukrainians want to live in peace and to be left alone.
Label: claim

Component: The highest level of cynicism is the Russian reference to the right of self-defence in a situation in which it is Russia that is acting as aggressor, having occupied Crimea, as is brutally interfering in the internal affairs of Ukraine, destabilizing it and trying to create an explosive situation in the eastern regions.
Label: claim

Component: Unfortunately, we are deeply concerned that the scenario that is prepared for eastern Ukraine might be similar to the one implemented by Russia in Abkhazia.
Label: claim

Component: That scenario might include several steps.
Label: claim

Component: Step one: a small group of local separatists, supported by Russian-controlled armed groups, would seize control over regional councils and make them illegally proclaim the creation ofa so-called independent Novorossiya within the boundaries described by President Putin at his recent press interview.
Label: premise

Component: We have already seen that step taken in Donetsk, Slovansk and Kharkiv, against the will of the vast majority of the local population and against the Ukrainian Constitution.
Label: premise

Component: Step two: the Russian Federation would immediately recognize such a regional unit as an independent State.
Label: premise

Component: Step three: upon a request from the newly self-proclaimed authorities, the Russian Federation would send its troops to Ukraine under the guise of peacekeepers or collective self-defence.
Label: premise

Component: I must say that such a scenario is realistic, as it has been reported that some Russian heavy military vehicles had been spotted near Ukraine's borders bearing signs indicating "Peacekeeping Mission" in the Russian and Ukrainian languages, exactly as happened in Abkhazia.
Label: claim

Component: One of the main purposes of that scenario is to disrupt the presidential elections scheduled for 25 May, which are a top priority for the Government and for the people of Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: Twelve days have already passed since the Geneva meeting.
Label: premise

Component: Ukraine has done its utmost to de-escalate the situation.
Label: claim

Component: Our steps have been acknowledged and supported by the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and other parties involved.
Label: premise

Component: Russia has done nothing.
Label: claim

Component: Russia has to implement the Geneva agreements.
Label: claim

Component: Russia should withdraw its army from Ukraine's borders.
Label: claim

Component: it should make a high-level statement calling on its prote'ges to free all hostages, to disarm and to vacate all seized administrative premises.
Label: claim

Component: It also has to condemn all terror and violence committed by those groups and to disassociate itself from such activities.
Label: claim

Component: Thirdly, it should stop its war-like rhetoric and start to act in a constructive and civilized manner.
Label: claim

Component: Russia must refrain from any actions aimed at undermining the 25 May presidential elections in Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: We call on the Security Council to give the most serious assessment of the actions and statements by Russia regarding Ukraine, and to take the most decisive steps to stop its aggressive appetite and to protect Ukrainian territorial integrity, which has been challenged once again.
Label: claim

Component: The only scenario that I would want to hear - but do not - is one that includes genuine efforts by the authorities in Kyiv to implement the Geneva document.
Label: claim

Component: But the actions backing it up need to be taken, first and foremost, by the authorities in Kyiv, if that is what they are.
Label: claim

Component: The Russian delegation called for today's emergency meeting of the Security Council with a view to considering the resumed punitive military operations undertaken by the authorities of the Kyiv regime, involving terrorists, the pro-fascist Right Sector and other ultranationalist organizations against their own people in south-eastern Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: A sub-unit of the Ukrainian army is using tanks, other heavy artillery and military helicopters to launch rocket striles against protesters and land troops.
Label: premise

Component: The first blood has already been spilled and reports are coming in about the killed and wounded.
Label: premise

Component: If the criminal misadventures of the Kyiv clique are not swiftly stopped, a catastrophic outcome for Ukraine cannot be averted.
Label: claim

Component: We have warned of this on many occasions.
Label: premise

Component: Punitive measures against its own people bear witness to the current Kyiv Government's inability or unwillingness to fulfil its obligations under the Geneva declaration of 17 April to ensure a speedy end to all violence and the launch of broad national dialogue, with the participation of all regions and political forces.
Label: claim

Component: it is now clear that the many statements of the so-called Government of Ukraine regarding its intention to begin nationwide dialogue in the search of settlement to the far-reaching crisis are nothing but hypocrisy.
Label: claim

Component: The regime in Kyiv, having abrogated the agreement of 21 February, is now openly violating its commitments under the Geneva declaration of 17 April, which require an urgent measures to end to all violence.
Label: claim

Component: at a time when Russia is striving to de-escalate and settle the crisis
Label: claim

Component: the Kyiv regime, with the support of its Western sponsors, has launched the full-scale use of military force, effectively annihilating any prospects for the implementation of the Geneva agreement.
Label: claim

Component: We are particularly concerned about information that, in the course of the punitive operations undertaken by the Ukrainian armed forces and illegal ultranationalist groups, English has been heard being spoken on the radio and English-speaking foreigners have been identified among those attacking in Sloviansk.
Label: premise

Component: We insist that all outside interference in the events in Ukraine is unacceptable.
Label: claim

Component: It is time for our Western colleagues to think twice, reason with their mentees in Ukraine, and stop toying with the destiny of the Ukrainian people to determine their own geopolitical goals.
Label: claim

Component: How else can we interpret yet another blatant example of the double standards wielded by the United States?
Label: claim

Component: Following the numerous attempts of Washington, DC, to tell Russia where and how its military should be properly deployed in its own territory, the White House has now been offended by our appeal to the Kyiv Government to withdraw its forces from eastern Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: I recall that Washington, DC, used frequently to ask former President Yanukovich of Ukraine not to use force against his people, and threatened him with all sorts of consequences.
Label: premise

Component: Now, however, in a strange twist of logic, force may and must be used against civilians by a Government that enjoys no legitimacy.
Label: claim

Component: The High Representative of the European Union is not far behind her United States colleagues, philosophizing about the State's monopoly on the use of force.
Label: premise

Component: her statement can only be characterized as provocative and inflammatory.
Label: claim

Component: It would seem that not only did the High Representative not participate in signing the Geneva declaration, but that she did not read it.
Label: claim

Component: the United States and the European Union bear great responsibility for effectively destroying the path to a peaceful solution to the crisis
Label: claim

Component: the categorical refusal of Washington, DC, to support the continuation of dialogue between the representatives of Kyiv and of south-eastern Ukraine, under the auspices ofthe OSCE, would hardly seem coincidental in its contravention of the Geneva declaration fo 17 April.
Label: claim

Component: What could be a more striking example than the fact that the United States is bent on the use of force?
Label: premise

Component: We call on Kyiv, its enablers and the signers of the Geneva declaration, the United States and the European Union, not to commit a fatal error and to make a sober assessment at all possible consequences of their actions.
Label: claim

Component: We call firmly on the West to end its destructive policy concerning Ukraine, and on the self-proclaimed authorities in Kyiv to swiftly halt all punitive operations and other measures against the people, free political prisoners and guarantee full freedom for journalists.
Label: claim

Component: That would represent a genuine process of de-escalation.
Label: premise

Component: There is a need for the urgent organization of authentic and equitable political dialogue, with the participation of all regions, to reach mutual agreement on the future of the country, rather than pretend to draft reforms within the small circle of self-styled Government of winners.
Label: claim

Component: Those who gave the criminal order to unleash bloodshed will bear full responsibility for whatever happens in Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: the Council flaunts its divisions and hence its powerlessness while that unhappy country sinks into anarchy.
Label: claim

Component: In eastern Ukraine, armed groups are gradually seizing the cities.
Label: premise

Component: They enjoy no crowds of supporters other than a few hundred demonstrators.
Label: premise

Component: Their heavy weaponry disqualigies them as mere sympathetic activists.
Label: premise

Component: Russian officers strut on local television.
Label: premise

Component: Observers of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and jouralists have been taken hostage
Label: premise

Component: Numerous people have been detained; more seriously, increasingly credible allegations are surfacing of enforced disappearances, killings and torture.
Label: premise

Component: These thugs have refused to implement the Geneva agreement that was intended to restore the Ukrainian State on its territory.
Label: claim

Component: What has Ukraine done?
Label: premise

Component: After showing a restraint that no other State would have exhbited in the presence of these attacks on its authority - attacks that have been organized, supported and justified by a neighbour - it decided to use its army and police against the armed gangs spreading a sense of insecurity at the expense of people most of whom do not support them.
Label: claim

Component: These gangs have so little in common with the spontaneous coelescence of local groups that they were able to shoot down a helicopter with a surface-to-air missile - which, it must be acknowledged, is not commonly found at the Kharkiv market.
Label: premise

Component: By what right would anyone meddle in the internal affairs of a State that is only seeking to restore its violated sovereignty?
Label: premise

Component: Russia has proven that by renouncing, one after the other, the principles underlying international life.
Label: claim

Component: But it still has a few regrets as it spirals downwards, so it tries, against all credibility, to blame the other.
Label: premise

Component: It invokes the agreement of 21 February, which it did not endorse and discovered only when it was too late.
Label: premise

Component: It brandishes the Geneva agreement, for the achievement of which it made no effort.
Label: premise

Component: it makes accusations that would be comical under different circumstances: the Nazis are in Kyiv, English speakers have infiltrated the ranks of Ukrainians - which makes me jealous that no French speakers are included - and, finally, the European Union is responsible for the violence.
Label: premise

Component: In reality, Russia has opened a Pandora's box.
Label: claim

Component: They have let the demon of nationalism escape.
Label: claim

Component: They have unleashed bands of thugs on Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: The only alternatives they are offering Kyiv are capitulation or partition
Label: claim

Component: we have been saying for weeks that we are seeking a de-escalation - we want a de-escalation.
Label: claim

Component: de-escalation implies that Russia will calm the armed groups it is equipping and training
Label: claim

Component: that it will see that the OSCE observers are freed - having still not publicly condemned their capture in the first place - and open negotiations with Ukraine
Label: claim

Component: that free elections will be held on 25 May under international supervision in order to give the Kyiv authorities indisputable legitimacy
Label: claim

Component: and that negotiations begin between Russia and Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: Compromises are possible.
Label: claim

Component: Ukraine is aware of the stakes and is ready, and the countries of Europe, the most closely concerned in this crisis, are too.
Label: premise

Component: Constitutional reform that responds to the concerns of the people of eastern Ukraine and respects Ukraine's sovereignty is quite conceivable.
Label: claim

Component: we have to put an end to this bad spy thriller, in which the Minister for Foreign Affairs is replaced by an information service when a crisis has to be resolved.
Label: premise

Component: What we need today is not a vodka-loving James Bond but diplomats who can return to the principles that form the foundations of international life.
Label: claim

Component: The Russian Federation has described this morning's events in eastern Ukraine as a punitive military operation against peaceful activists.
Label: premise

Component: This is yet again a gross distortion of the facts.
Label: claim

Component: The Ukrainian Government has the right, and indeed the responsibility, to uphold the rule of law and protect its citizens in its own territory.
Label: claim

Component: in doing so it should at all times act in a proportionate and measured way.
Label: claim

Component: The actions undertaken this morning by Ukrainian security forces in and around Sloviansk appear to have been just that, in an effort to relieve the city from the armed groups, sponsored and controlled by Russia, that have been terrorizing the local population.
Label: premise

Component: We urge them to continue to make every effort to ensure that the risks to civilians are minimized.
Label: claim

Component: There is no Council member sitting around this table that would allow its towns to be overrun by armed militants.
Label: premise

Component: None of us would abrogate responsibility for the protection of citizens on our own territory who are being intimidated and brutalized by heavily armed groups backed by a neighbouring country.
Label: premise

Component: Proportionate is not the same as passive.
Label: claim

Component: The scale of Russian hypocrisy is breathtaking.
Label: claim

Component: Russia stoutly supports, and indeed arms, the most repressive regimes in the world, notably Syria, a regime that brutally represses dissent without any sense of restraint or concern for the protection of civilians.
Label: premise

Component: Russia's synthetic indignation over Ukraine's proportionate and measured actions convinces no one.
Label: premise

Component: Russian claims that these are peaceful activists are simply not credible.
Label: premise

Component: Peaceful activists do not have the means or the capability to shoot down three Ukrainian military helicopters, reportedly using man-portable air defence systems.
Label: premise

Component: The use of such sophisticated weaponry against Ukrainian forces reaffirms our assessment that the armed groups in eastern Ukraine include professionals funded, equipped and directed by Russia.
Label: premise

Component: The situation in eastern Ukraine has continued to deteriorate.
Label: claim

Component: Armed groups stormed the Prosecutor's office in Donetsk yesterday, further increasing the number of Government buildings occupied since the 17 April Geneva agreement.
Label: premise

Component: We remain seriously concerned about the kidnapping and continued detention of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe's Vienna Document inspectors, and call on Russia to condemn this criminal act and use its influence over those who are holding the inspectors to bring about their immediate, safe and unconditional release.
Label: claim

Component: We are deeply disturbed by the reports of abductions and intimidation of journalists reporting from eastern Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: what we are seeing in Ukraine is a torrent of disinformation and propaganda.
Label: claim

Component: Three days ago, all the members of the Council emphasized the importance of the 17 April agreement and its implementation (see S/PV.7I65).
Label: premise

Component: Abiding by that agreement remains the best way to de-escalate the volatile and dangerous situation in eastern Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: It is therefore regrettable that Russia's presidential press secretary said this morning that Russia did not think it any longer possible to implement the 17 April agreement.
Label: claim

Component: Worsening instability in Ukraine is in no one's long-term interest.
Label: premise

Component: We urge Russia to step back from such rhetoric, to desist from its inflammatory propaganda and to commit to de-escalating a perilous situation.
Label: claim

Component: We urge Russia to throw its full weight behind the 17 April agreement and rein in the militant armed groups that it supports and that are responsible for the current crisis.
Label: claim

Component: Russia is pushing two monumental falsehoods right now.
Label: claim

Component: The first falsehood is that the Ukrainians are carrying out a large-scale, uncontrolled, violent attack on unarmed civilians.
Label: claim

Component: That is false
Label: premise

Component: The Ukrainian Government is carrying out a targeted effort to contain Russian-sponsored paramilitary violence emanating from Sloviansk, in an effort to deliver security for Ukrainian citizens.
Label: premise

Component: There is horrible violence in eastern Ukraine, and that violence is coming, as it has been for weeks now, from Russian-directed agents and paramilitaries and their associates.
Label: premise

Component: The second monumental falsehood is that the Russian Federation is deeply concerned about the instability in the east.
Label: claim

Component: The rest of us are deeply and sincerely concerned by that instability.
Label: premise

Component: But despite all its rhetoric, Russia cannot be, because Russia is causing the instability.
Label: premise

Component: This expressed concern is cynical and disingenuous, and meant only to distract us from the reality that is playing out before our eyes.
Label: premise

Component: From the outset, the Government of Ukraine has sought to resolve all issues peacefully through dialogue, both internally and with the Russian Federation.
Label: claim

Component: This policy of restraint continued even after Russia subverted Crimea, orchestrated an undemocratic separatist vote in Crimea, invaded Crimea and announced to the world that it had annexed Crimea - while lying about its intentions and even its presence in Crimea every step of the way.
Label: premise

Component: As its country has been carved up, as foreign operatives have moved into its homeland, as masses of Russian troops have assembled along its eastern border, and as Moscow has continued to threaten its territorial integrity and its people
Label: premise

Component: Ukraine has continuously, day after day, shown remarkable, almost unimaginable, restraint.
Label: claim

Component: It has done as the Council has asked.
Label: premise

Component: It has implemented its international agreements.
Label: premise

Component: It has refrained from military responses to aggression, even as Russia proudly announced that it had annexed part of Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: Ukraine has over and over again committed and recommitted itselfto direct dialogue with Moscow.
Label: premise

Component: And yet, in return for Ukraine's reasonableness, Russia has destabilized, threatened and terrorized.
Label: claim

Component: In past weeks, the same scenario that played itself out in Crimea has been repeating itself in parts of eastern Ukraine
Label: premise

Component: the same sudden appearance of unfamiliar men and new armaments
Label: premise

Component: the same strategy of occupying buildings and taking control ofthe media
Label: premise

Component: the same vicious propaganda directed against the Government of Ukraine and the same denials of Russian involvement
Label: premise

Component: and the same cries of outrage whenever Ukraine takes a step to assert its own rights, enforce its own laws, protect its own citizens and restore order on its own territory.
Label: premise

Component: Their response is reasonable, it is proportional and, frankly, it is what any one of our countries would have done in the face of that threat.
Label: claim

Component: Imagine for a moment if 26,000 square kilometres of Russian territory were seized by another country.
Label: premise

Component: Would Moscow show restraint, week after week, day after day, in the hopes that rational dialogue rather than brute force would prevail?
Label: premise

Component: How would President Putin respond, if parts of his country were seized, to requests to remove his army from those parts of the country?
Label: premise

Component: Seriously, there is some irony in Russian demands, given the manner in which it would deal with separatism within its borders.
Label: premise

Component: It has been 63 days since Russia began its campaign to annex Crimea, and for 63 days, day after day, the Ukrainian Government has chosen peace.
Label: premise

Component: Yet in those same 63 days, Russia, day after day, has chosen to pursue more territory.
Label: premise

Component: Pro-Russian separatists have seized the Donetsk railway control centre and stopped almost all train movements.
Label: premise

Component: That is an illegal act.
Label: claim

Component: Separatists seized control of the Donetsk General Prosecutor's office, in a violent clash that left more than two dozen people hospitalized.
Label: premise

Component: Separatists seized the General Prosecutor's office in Horlivka.
Label: premise

Component: Pro-Russian activists beat up two Radio Svoboda journalists who were filming a protest near the Kharkiv regional administration building on 1 May.
Label: premise

Component: All told, in 17 towns in eastern Ukraine 32 buildings are under occupation, 21 by armed personnel.
Label: premise

Component: In addition, we have seen dozens of Ukrainian public officials illegally detained, three bodies pulled from a river near Donetsk and a group of eight, now seven, monitors of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) abducted, in direct defiance not simply of Ukraine's Government but of the Council and the world community.
Label: premise

Component: Alongside all of that action, we have heard the Russian Federation building its case for intervention - outright intervention - including President Putin saying that eastern Ukrainian cities and Odessa were not even part of Ukraine in the "good old days", harkening back to the glory of Novorossiysk.
Label: premise

Component: And Ambassador Churkin has taken the United Nations Charter's name in vein by invoking Article 51 in self-defence, as activated during the Russian takeover of parts of Georgia and relevant here in the context of the crisis in eastern Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: The country that has a right of self-defence, Ambassador Churkin, is Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: Russia's military intervention in Ukraine is a clear violation of international law, and Russia fools no one by calling its troops "peacekeepers".
Label: claim

Component: Unfortunately, Russia does have a track record of using the term "peacekeeping" as cover for unlawful military intervention and occupation without authorization from the Security Council.
Label: premise

Component: There is no evidence that the Ukrainian Government has targeted Russian nationals or threatened Russia in any way, in stark contrast to the ongoing Russian actions to destabilize eastern Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: Those separatists are not engaged in peaceful protest on behalf of their rights.
Label: premise

Component: Their rights are not being threatened.
Label: premise

Component: Their ability to use their language and have it recognized by the Government is not being threatened.
Label: premise

Component: Their ability to participate fully as voters and citizens is not being threatened.
Label: premise

Component: It is their methods that have been intentionally provocative and threatening.
Label: premise

Component: The separatists are not pressing their case peacefully.
Label: claim

Component: They are using baseball bats, metal bars, clubs and knives.
Label: premise

Component: Those are not activists, they are armed operatives.
Label: claim

Component: It must stop.
Label: claim

Component: Since the beginning of the crisis, the Ukrainian Government has acted in good faith and with admirable restraint.
Label: claim

Component: The area around Kyiv City Hall is now clear of all Maidan barricades and protesters.
Label: premise

Component: Over the Easter holiday, Ukraine voluntarily suspended its counter-terrorism initiative, choosing to de-escalate, despite its fundamental right to provide security on its own territory and for its own people.
Label: premise

Component: Even today, as a it tries to lawfully restore order, Ukrainian security forces are operating in a cautious and restrained manner.
Label: premise

Component: Unlike the separatists, Ukraine has cooperated fully with the OSCE special monitoring mission and allowed its observers to operate in regions about which Moscow had voiced concerns regarding the treatment of ethnic Russians.
Label: premise

Component: In addition, Prime Minister Yatsenyuk has publicly committed his Government to undertake far-reaching constitutional reforms that will strengthen the power of the regions.
Label: premise

Component: He has appealed personally to Russian-speaking Ukrainians, pledging to support a special status for the Russian language and to protect those who use it.
Label: premise

Component: He announced legislation to grant amnesty to those who surrendered arms.
Label: premise

Component: The fact that Ukraine has now taken some steps to try to restore order is to be expected.
Label: claim

Component: It is justified.
Label: premise

Component: It is what each and every one of the States we represent would do in a similar situation, and would probably have done far earlier.
Label: premise

Component: The fact that Russia has chosen to call an emergency meeting in protest
Label: claim

Component: the authorities in Moscow either underestimate the intelligence of the world community or that they are trying to exactly replicate in eastern Ukraine the Charade that they were responsible for in Crimea.
Label: premise

Component: Just as Russia and its pro-Russian militia allies engage in a dramatic and dangerous campaign in eastern Ukraine, the Russian Government is spreading some of its most wild propaganda and fantasy stories since the beginning of the crisis.
Label: claim

Component: Over the course of the aggression, some of those entrusted with carrying out the functions of the municipal Government and those reporting impartially on the facts have begun to slowly disappear.
Label: premise

Component: Local council members, local police and journalists are missing and being held by armed operatives.
Label: premise

Component: International observers from the Vienna Document observation team, as the Council knows, are being held in hostage.
Label: premise

Component: Today's Russian Foreign Ministry ridiculous and false statement purporting Western intervention would not be so alarming if it did not suggest that Moscow is looking for nothing short ofa pretext to invade.
Label: premise

Component: Russia may have the power to instigate fear, to spread lies and to sow discord, violence and disarray across its border.
Label: claim

Component: It may even have the power to abuse its veto at the Security Council.
Label: claim

Component: it cannot veto the truth.
Label: claim

Component: These are dangerous days for Ukraine and for all of us.

Component: In September we engaged in arrangements with the hope of ending the bloodshed and ensuring sustainable peace.
Label: claim

Component: To fulfil that goal the terms of the agreement must be implemented in full by all involved in the trilateral dialogue.
Label: premise

Component: We urge the Council to hold all signatories to their commitments.
Label: claim

Component: I believe that it is inappropriate to bring to the Security Council discussions that are ongoing in the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE), particularly in regard to the implementation of the provisions of the Minsk agreements regarding border monitoring.
Label: claim

Component: The ceasefire did not take place.
Label: claim

Component: However, we went even further.
Label: claim

Component: even in the absence of a ceasefire, we would be ready to deploy the observers on the Russian side of the Russian-Ukrainian border.
Label: premise

Component: That was a significant gesture by the Russian Federation
Label: claim

Component: any criticism in that regard is unacceptable
Label: claim

Component: The sequence is first and foremost based on the implementation of the ceasefire, which unfortunately did not take place.
Label: claim

Component: He asserted that civilians are dying as a result of such shelling.
Label: premise

Component: that is of course very unfortunate.
Label: claim

Component: civilians, sometimes as many as 19 people in one day, are dying in the Donbas region as a result of shells being fired by the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
Label: claim

Component: The representative of Ukraine says that its armed forces are not responsible, but what about the battalions under Ukrainian command?
Label: premise

Component: It seems that they are under such command but the impression is that they are not.
Label: claim

Component: our Ukrainian colleague could do no better than give an unverified version of events, according to which a separatist missile shot down the Malaysian Airlines flight.
Label: premise

Component: I want to reiterate that it is irresponsible to voice unverified accounts in the Security Council.
Label: claim

Component: False information that was supposed to affirm a particular version of events was given.
Label: claim

Component: Because if one has information, why not share it?
Label: premise

Component: Why keep it secret?
Label: premise

Component: What is more serious is the fact that our experts have drawn up some 40 important questions that need to be answered in order to understand what happened.
Label: premise

Component: The Ukrainian representative has made no attempt to reply to a single one of those questions.
Label: premise

Component: It is time for him to cease - in particular at Security Council meetings - his endless repetitions of unverified versions of events and to answer those questions.
Label: claim

Component: I would like to agree with my Russian colleague on the importance of answering all questions that need to be answered in respect of the independent investigation that is currently under way with regard to Flight MH-l7.
Label: claim

Component: That investigation is independent.
Label: claim

Component: It is being undertaken by an independent body - the Dutch Safety Board.
Label: premise

Component: Participation in that investigation includes two Russian experts.
Label: premise

Component: Our Australian experts are, of course, participating in that investigation, but I, as a member ofthe Australian Government, do not have access to the nature or detail of that participation.
Label: premise

Component: It is an independent investigation that has drawn up one preliminary report so far but which continues.
Label: claim

Component: I therefore agree with my Russian colleague that such kinds of questions need to be looked at.
Label: claim

Component: But the fact is that we have an independent investigation.
Label: claim

Component: It enjoys the participation of all those who need to be involved, including Russian experts, and is being undertaken in accordance with accepted international guidelines
Label: premise

Component: I said was that all the apparent evidence that has been produced so far, while not conclusive, is consistent with the initial assessment that that event, that atrocity, was consistent with a surface-to-air missile from the areas and in the terms that I mentioned.
Label: claim

Component: I did not assert that that was a definitive conclusion - certainly not yet
Label: claim

Component: I regret that it continues to use such unconstructive rhetoric.
Label: claim

Component: The Government of Ukraine condemns all crimes, especially serious crimes in breach of international law.
Label: claim

Component: Any such crimes should be properly investigated.
Label: claim

Component: Russia is casting such unfounded allegations against Ukraine in order to distract the attention of the international community from the main issue, which is the Russsian aggression against Ukraine and its interference into the domestic affairs of my country.
Label: claim

Component: The occupation of Crimea, the instigation of unrest in eastern Ukraine and the supply of weapons and manpower for the needs of the separatist movements in Ukraine are among the main causes of those dramatic events.
Label: premise

Component: I have not heard from the Russian delegation a firm willingness to comply strictly with the Minsk arrangements, to which it is a party.
Label: premise

Component: We have not heard any expression of Russia's firm intention to withdraw its troops from Ukraine or its readiness to cooperate with Ukraine in establishing effective control over the State border.
Label: premise

Component: We have not heard a condemnation of the serious crimes committed by the illegal armed groups, crimes that are clearly reflected in the United Nations Monitoring Mission's report.
Label: premise

Component: We also had expected that Russia would condemn the intentions of the separatists to hold local elections on 2 November, an act that would Violate the Minsk arrangements, signed by Ukraine and Russia.
Label: premise

Component: It would be quite difficult to settle the situation in eastern Ukraine without addressing that issue, as noted in our statement today.
Label: claim

Component: The leadership of Ukraine has demonstrated by its deeds its readiness and willingness to work for a peaceful resolution.
Label: claim

Component: It is time for the other parties to step up and show their sincere will to engage in dialogue.
Label: claim

Component: I do not think we need to have a broad discussion on the independent investigation, but I am very happy that he sounded so constructive about the investigation.
Label: claim

Component: The Australian Permanent Representative stated that the version referred to today is supposedly generally accepted or that it might be the version resulting from such an investigation.
Label: premise

Component: That simply is not the case.
Label: claim

Component: It was just a version constructed by the United States, which did not provide any justification.
Label: premise

Component: That version simply stated that a missile was fired from the region that was supposedly under the control of the separatists.
Label: premise

Component: We have not heard any proof.
Label: premise

Component: Yet a few days after the tragedy, that same region was visited by a journalist from the Russian Service of the BBC, who gave a four-minute report from there, which clearly demonstrated that no one had shot any missiles from that location.
Label: premise

Component: that report was posted on the BBC website for only half a day and was then taken down.
Label: premise

Component: I suppose it was not considered interesting enough to remain.
Label: claim

Component: Russia's flagrant violation of Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity.
Label: claim

Component: Time and again, Russia has made commitments and then failed to live up to them, and subsequently offered explanations to the Council that it knows are untrue.
Label: claim

Component: The most recent example involves the joint commitments made by Russia, the separatists it supports and Ukraine on 5 September in Minsk.
Label: premise

Component: They include an immediate end to the ceasefire violations, the restoration of Ukrainian control of its side of the international border, OSCE monitoring of the border and a security zone on either side of the border, as well as the withdrawal of foreign forces, mercenaries and equipment from Ukraine and the release of hostages and prisoners.
Label: premise

Component: On none of those have Russia or the separatists lived up to their word.
Label: claim

Component: the separatists have taken advantage of the agreed-upon pause in the fighting to try and expand their territory beyond Minsk lines.
Label: claim

Component: Meanwhile, Ukraine has maintained a full ceasefire along the agreed lines, as it defends its forces and population from separatists' push for more.
Label: claim

Component: At Minsk, all sides committed to permitting the OSCE to monitor and verify the ceasefire.
Label: premise

Component: Yet Russian- backed separatists have fired on OSCE monitoring drones and used jamming signals to interfere with its team members' electronics using equipment supplied by Moscow.
Label: claim

Component: At Minsk, all sides agreed to permanent monitoring at the Ukrainian-Russian State border and the creation of a security zone along the border.
Label: premise

Component: Yet Russia has done nothing to restore Ukrainian Government control over the international border.
Label: claim

Component: Russia has refused to press separatists to allow the OSCE access to the border, and Russia continues to flout Ukrainian air space with its helicopters and unmanned aerial vehicles.
Label: premise

Component: It also continues to send so-called humanitarian convoys - convoys it will not allow Ukrainian customs authorities or international monitors to search.
Label: premise

Component: At Minsk, all sides committed to immediately free all hostages and illegally held persons.
Label: premise

Component: Yet Russia and the separatists it backs continue to hold approximately 500 captives.
Label: claim

Component: Those captives include Ukrainian pilot Nadia Savchenko and Ukrainian film director Oleg Sentsov, both of whom were captured by separatists on Ukrainian soil and illegally transported against their will to Russia.
Label: premise

Component: At Minsk, Russia committed to remove all illegal military formations, military equipment and militants from Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: Yet, rather than withdrawing its military forces from Ukraine and rather than cutting off its support for separatists, Russia is instead surging more forces and more equipment across the border.
Label: claim

Component: The Russian military has maintained a forward presence in eastern Ukraine since the ceasefire took effect.
Label: claim

Component: We have information indicating that a Russian air-defence system was operating near one of the separatist convoys in Donetsk.
Label: premise

Component: Russia has not provided that type of air- defence system to separatists to date, suggesting that Russian forces were protecting the convoy.
Label: premise

Component: On 9 November, the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission reported two convoys of 17 unmarked green trucks moving west through Donetsk towards the ceasefire line.
Label: premise

Component: Yesterday, 11 November, OSCE monitors observed the movement of 43 unmarked military vehicles on the eastern outskirts of Donetsk.
Label: premise

Component: Five were seen towing l20-millimetre howitzers and five others were towing multiple-launch rocket systems.
Label: premise

Component: NATO confirmed it had observed columns of Russian equipment - primarily Russian tanks, Russian artillery, Russian air-defence systems and Russian combat troops - entering Ukraine over the past 48 hours.
Label: premise

Component: The list goes on, but the pattern is clear.
Label: premise

Component: Where Russia has made commitments, it has failed to meet them.
Label: claim

Component: Russia negotiated a peace plan, then systematically undermined it at every step
Label: claim

Component: It talks of peace, but it keeps fuelling war.
Label: claim

Component: That is not all.
Label: claim

Component: On 2 November, Russian-backed separatists held illegal elections in the parts of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions that they control.
Label: premise

Component: The elections contravene Ukraine's laws and its sovereignty.
Label: premise

Component: They defied point 9 of the Minsk protocol.
Label: premise

Component: But if Russia and the separatists intended the elections to cast a veneer of legitimacy on their actions, they failed.
Label: claim

Component: Instead, the world saw the elections for what they are: a shameless attempt to validate territory seized at the barrel of the gun - a gun provided by Russia.
Label: claim

Component: In keeping with its efforts to escalate rather than de-escalate at every turn, rather than condemn the separatists" sham election like most of the international community, Russia encouraged it.
Label: premise

Component: Russian and separatist actions in eastern Ukraine currently have nothing to do with improving the humanitarian situation in Donbas, or decentralizing power, as called for in points 3 and 8 of the Minsk protocol.
Label: claim

Component: A recent Associated Press (AP) report from the rebel-held town of Perevalsk, part of the territory that recently declared independence from Ukraine, revealed the town was ruled by a local warlord who goes by the name of "batya" - or "daddy".
Label: premise

Component: Daddy's power is maintained by a group of armed Cossacks, whom he calls his Great Don Army, and four tanks outside his office fly Russian and rebel flags.
Label: premise

Component: Asked where his authority came from, Daddy told the AP reporter:  "We are an independent organization and we don't depend on anyone
Label: premise

Component: I am answerable only to President Putin and Our Lord."
Label: premise

Component: In neighbouring Alchevsk village rebel leaders preside over the kangaroo trials of people accused of crimes.
Label: premise

Component: Defendants are not given lawyers and their judges are whatever members of the community show up, who vote by a simple show of hands.
Label: premise

Component: That is what the separatist democracy looks like.
Label: claim

Component: We continue to see similar repressive tendencies in Russian-occupied Crimea, where members of the Tatar minority have been relentlessly persecuted and the free press muzzled.
Label: premise

Component: By contrast, Ukraine has made a genuine effort to live up to its agreements at Minsk and continues to show considerable restraint in response to constant provocation and attack.
Label: claim

Component: The Ukrainian people have repeatedly chosen leaders who call for de-escalation over escalation, first in the presidential election and then in parliamentary elections.
Label: premise

Component: Ukraine has also put in motion critically important reforms to reduce corruption and grant greater authority to its regions through constitutional reform.
Label: premise

Component: It has sought to maintain the ceasefire along the lines established at Minsk.
Label: premise

Component: The United States continues to support the Minsk peace process, and we continue to call for its full implementation.
Label: claim

Component: We remain prepared to roll back sanctions if the fighting stops, the border is closed, the foreign forces and equipment are withdrawn and hostages are released.
Label: claim

Component: there is no military solution to the crisis.
Label: claim

Component: The solution, as has been said, by the OSCE here today and United Nations, must be political.
Label: claim

Component: The problem is, as it has long been throughout this crisis, you cannot reach a political solution if only one side is committed to forging it, and you cannot effectively implement a road map with parties who, like the Russians and the separatists they back, so consistently fail to keep their word.
Label: claim

Component: We have seen Russia's playbook in Transnistria, South Ossetia, Abkhazia and Crimea - so the question is not what Russia will try to do in eastern Ukraine, the question is what we, the international community, will seek to do to prevent yet another frozen conflict in Europe manufactured by Russia.
Label: premise

Component: The Minsk agreement was brokered under the auspices of the international community; as such, there must be consequences when Russia flouts the commitments it has made and continues to destabilize its neighbour.
Label: premise

Component: Russia has not earned the good faith we would wish to bestow.
Label: claim

Component: Even when Russia claims, as Foreign Minister Lavrov did today, "the inadmissibility of disrupting the implementation of the Minsk ceasefire agreements" actions are all that matter - and actions alongside these words show intentions.
Label: premise

Component: The Donetsk airport has come under attacks from artillery and arms fire four times in the past 24 hours, and in the past day Ukrainian positions have been shelled near Debaltseve, Avdiyivka, Hirske and Krasnohorivka.
Label: premise

Component: What we can do - what we must do - is keep ratcheting up the pressure on Russia until it abides by Minsk and chooses the path of de-escalation.
Label: claim

Component: Russia's actions in Ukraine are a threat not only to the countries in Russia's immediate vicinity but also to the international order.
Label: claim

Component: the security situation in Ukraine has deteriorated further, despite the extensive diplomatic efforts deployed in the region over the past month.
Label: claim

Component: It seems that when the region takes a step forward, the parties respond with two steps backwards, at the expense of the civilian population.
Label: claim

Component: We should remember, as Ambassador Tagliavini has reminded us, that winter is around the corner and that with increased fighting, coupled with a shortage of gas in Ukraine, a humanitarian disaster is looming.
Label: premise

Component: It is disappointing that despite the signing of the Minsk protocol and memorandum on 5 and 19 September, respectively, the parties seem unwilling to implement those agreements.
Label: claim

Component: We are seriously concerned about the continued violation of the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, the massive reinforcement of the armed separatists with heavy weaponry, including via military convoys, as well as the continued shelling in populated areas, including, last week, ofa school.
Label: premise

Component: In that context, we commend the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission for its continuing role in verifying the ceasefire on Ukraine's eastern border.
Label: claim

Component: We urge all parties, particularly the armed separatists, to assist the Mission in implementing its mandate, and we also encourage those who have the capacity to provide the monitors with the equipment they need to do so, in order to improve the success of its activities.
Label: claim

Component: It is unfortunate that the deterioration of the security situation in Ukraine comes on the heels of the parliamentary elections of 26 October, which were viewed as free, fair and peaceful, despite the fact that there were no polling stations in the rebel-held areas.
Label: premise

Component: we believe that the subsequent elections organized on 2 November by the armed separatists are unconstitutional and undermine the Minsk protocol and memorandum.
Label: claim

Component: In a context of heightened tension and escalation, we note with concern statements from all sides that may jeopardize even the provisions of the Minsk agreements that had begun to be implemented, such as those on the exchange ofprisoners of war and the law on interim local self-government.
Label: premise

Component: It is therefore imperative that, given the alarming situation, all the signatories recommit to implementing the Minsk agreements and that members of the Trilateral Contact Group use their influence to end the dangerous escalation.
Label: claim

Component: Otherwise, despite our collective commitment made yesterday on the occasion of Remembrance Day, the situation could get out of hand and lead to another full-blown regional war on the European continent.
Label: premise

Component: the situation in Ukraine has become a threat to international peace and security
Label: claim

Component: I believe it is time for the 15 to at least agree that the Council should remain seized of the matter under a specific agenda item, "The situation in Ukraine".
Label: claim

Component: Jordan is extremely concerned by the worsening security situation and the increase in shelling in eastern Ukraine, which follows a period of tenuous calm in the region.
Label: premise

Component: there could be spillover effects beyond Ukraine and into the entire region.
Label: claim

Component: Jordan believes that the military build-up and the illegal flow of weapons into Ukraine, as stated in the report of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, are violations of the Minsk agreements.
Label: claim

Component: Any attempt by the parties to resume the fighting flouts international efforts aimed at reaching a lasting and peaceful solution to the conflict.
Label: premise

Component: We reiterate our call to all parties, in particular armed groups, to show restraint and discipline, calm the situation and make intensive, serious and sincere efforts to prevent a further worsening of the situation, which would be dire for all concerned.
Label: claim

Component: Any deferral of a political solution based on the peace agreements will only further exacerbate violence and instability and bring about a worsening of the humanitarian situation, which must be addressed.
Label: premise

Component: Any delay will only further prolong the ongoing investigation of the Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-l7 crash.
Label: premise

Component: The shared challenges have to be tackled by all Ukrainians across the board, be they in the east or the west of the country.
Label: premise

Component: I am referring to the political reforms, national reconciliation and economic development.
Label: premise

Component: Those shared challenges and can be tackled only through cooperation among all the parties so as to ensure that the conflict not worsen irreversibly.
Label: premise

Component: In that regard, the holding of legislative elections in the country on 26 October was an important step on the path to political reform, which the Ukrainian Government has committed itself to.
Label: claim

Component: We therefore encourage the Government to continue its efforts to step up the national dialogue and to put in place all the necessary political and economic reforms that can contribute to the national reconciliation process among all members of Ukrainian society
Label: claim

Component: Jordan will continue to back the Minsk agreements.
Label: claim

Component: We stress the importance of cooperation among all parties for a comprehensive and swift implementation of all the provisions of the agreements, including provisions regarding the ceasefire and the halting of weapons flows.
Label: claim

Component: We emphasize the need to uphold and maintain the territorial integrity and sovereignty of Ukraine, as undermining those would be a violation of international law.
Label: claim

Component: We also recall that it is crucial that there be no impunity or immunity for those having perpetrated violations or acts of violence.
Label: claim

Component: We further recall that such individuals must be brought before justice to ensure that the situation in Ukraine not further deteriorate.
Label: claim

Component: Luxembourg fully supports the efforts of the Swiss Chairman-in-Office of the OSCE to find a political solution to the crisis, while fully upholding the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: We also support the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission, which has a key role to play to promote the de-escalation of tensions by providing objective information on the situation on the ground.
Label: claim

Component: We are very concerned by the serious deterioration of the situation in eastern Ukraine since 2 November, when the separatists held illegal elections in the regions of the Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts under their control.
Label: claim

Component: non-compliance with key provisions of the Minsk agreements has led to a new escalation of tensions and a worsening situation in several regions of eastern Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: The growing number of violations of the 5 September ceasefire agreement are compounded by worrisome omens.
Label: claim

Component: We are concerned about the recent build-up of Russian troops in the immediate proximity of the Ukrainian border.
Label: premise

Component: We are also concerned about the increased movements of military convoy in separatist-controlled areas heading for Ukrainian army positions.
Label: premise

Component: As has been noted, in recent days the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission has reported sightings of large convoys of military trucks without license plates transporting troops and heavy weapons, including howitzers.
Label: premise

Component: A convoy of nine tanks - four T-72s and five T-64s - heading west was observed by the Mission on Saturday, 8 November.
Label: premise

Component: These movements of troops and heavy weaponry are accompanied by intensified bombing, especially in Donetsk
Label: claim

Component: We condemn the sham elections held on 2 November in the eastern regions of Ukraine controlled by the separatists, with the blessing of Russia.
Label: claim

Component: We do not recognize those elections.
Label: claim

Component: They are illegal under the Constitution and Ukrainian law.
Label: premise

Component: They constitute a flagrant violation of the commitments that Russia and the representatives of illegal armed groups made when signing the Minsk protocol.
Label: premise

Component: Those sham elections do not legitimize the warlords at the head of the self- proclaimed republics of Donetsk and Luhansk, just as the illegal referendum in Crimea does not and will not legitimize the annexation of the peninsula by Russia.
Label: claim

Component: Successive reports of the Special Monitoring Mission bear witness to serious violations of human rights committed since April in areas occupied by armed separatist groups.
Label: premise

Component: These individuals cannot claim to speak for the people of Donbas.
Label: claim

Component: The Secretary-General and the OSCE Chairperson-in-Office have rightly denounced the elections of 2 November as an obstacle to efforts to find a political solution to the conflict
Label: premise

Component: We welcome the concrete steps taken by Ukraine to meet its commitments under the Minsk agreements, in particular the adoption of laws providing for amnesty and the temporary status of local autonomy.
Label: claim

Component: of particular importance is the withdrawal of armed groups, military equipment, combatants and illegal mercenaries, as well as securing the border between Ukraine and Russia and its permanent monitoring with OSCE verification.
Label: claim

Component: It is crucial in this context that the Mission's monitoring of the border posts at Gukovo and Donetsk be extended to other border-crossing areas as soon as possible.
Label: claim

Component: It becomes more urgent every day to end the conflict impacting Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: The conflict has already killed more than 4,000 people since April.
Label: premise

Component: The victims include numerous children, including two struck down on 5 November by mortar shells on a school playing field in Donetsk.
Label: premise

Component: The killing must stop.
Label: claim

Component: The solution to the conflict has been identified
Label: claim

Component: it includes the good-faith implementation of the Minsk protocol of 5 September and the Minsk memorandum of 19 September, signed by all parties to the conflict, with the decisive verification support of the OSCE.
Label: premise

Component: Ukraine has demonstrated in deed its determination to pursue the path of peace.
Label: claim

Component: We call on the separatists and Russia to do the same so as to halt the spiral of conflict.
Label: claim

Component: We call on the Russian Federation to shoulder its responsibilities in the full and complete implementation of the Minsk agreements by preventing all military movement of weapons or combatants from its territory into Ukraine and by exercising its influence on the separatists to fulfil the obligations to which they have subscribed under the Minsk agreements.
Label: claim

Component: We are acutely alarmed by the observations reported by the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission, detailing the influx of military equipment, weapons and armed personnel into the region of Ukraine held by armed rebel groups.
Label: premise

Component: It represents a clear violation of the Minsk agreements, a serious encroachment on the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, and a challenge to the future of the country.
Label: claim

Component: The withdrawal of foreign troops and military equipment under OSCE monitoring is an integral part of the Minsk agreements, which must be fully implemented.
Label: claim

Component: We urge all concerned parties to stop any provocative actions that may derail the fragile peace process, as embodied in the Minsk agreements.
Label: claim

Component: All outside military intervention in the situation must cease immediately.
Label: claim

Component: Regarding political developments in the country, we welcome the holding of parliamentary elections on 26 October
Label: claim

Component: which proved to be orderly and peaceful.
Label: premise

Component: In that regard, the separate elections held by armed rebel groups in eastern Ukraine earlier this month run counter to the spirit of a dialogue-based resolution of the situation.
Label: premise

Component: They also undermine the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: We commend the role of OSCE, the United Nations and other partners in seeking a peaceful political resolution of the situation, and we stand ready to support such efforts.
Label: claim

Component: The situation in Ukraine continues to be a severe threat and indeed an escalating threat to international peace and security.
Label: claim

Component: There is a reason why that is so.
Label: premise

Component: Since the start of the crisis, Russian actions have been consistently designed to undermine, interfere with and transgress Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity in a way that flouts international norms, including the Charter of the United Nations.
Label: premise

Component: Since the Council last met on 24 October to discuss Ukraine (see S/PV.7287), Russia and the separatists it supports have repeatedly undermined and ignored the Minsk agreements.
Label: premise

Component: Russian leaders have told us one thing and then ordered their military, their special forces and their separatist rebel proxies to do another.
Label: premise

Component: The ceasefire has been breached.
Label: premise

Component: Attempts to monitor and verify the ceasefire and the border have been blocked.
Label: premise

Component: Russia continues to supply its soldiers in Ukraine and the separatists they fight alongside with heavy weaponry, artillery, tanks and armoured vehicles in flagrant breach of the Minsk protocols.
Label: premise

Component: Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) reporting in recent days lays bare the extent of that Russian support.
Label: premise

Component: On several separate occasions, the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission has witnessed significant numbers of troops and military equipment moving in convoy in separatist-held areas.
Label: premise

Component: On 8 November, the Mission observed a convoy of more than 40 unmarked military vehicles moving west on the outskirts of Donetsk.
Label: premise

Component: It included 19 unmarked Kamaz trucks, each towing a howitzer artillery piece and carrying personnel in green uniforms without insignia; 15 Kraz troop carriers; 6 fuel tankers; and an unmarked Bronetransporter armoured personnel carrier.
Label: premise

Component: We have seen this pattern before - unmarked columns of military vehicles entering Ukraine to support continued fighting by separatists.
Label: premise

Component: Efforts to remove markings and insignia from those vehicles cannot disguise the fact that they come from Russia.
Label: premise

Component: Yet Russia continues to deny that fact
Label: claim

Component: despite the fact that its attempts at deception turned to farce only yesterday when Russian television station NTV broadcast footage of an armoured personnel carrier at the head of a column in Donetsk bearing markings from the Russian city of Ryazan.
Label: premise

Component: If Russia is not supplying separatists across the border, then why does it continue to block any expansion of OSCE border monitoring?
Label: premise

Component: Russia must implement the commitment it made at Minsk to allow the monitoring of its border with Ukraine, of which only 2 kilometres are currently observed by the OSCE.
Label: claim

Component: Flights of OSCE unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) above Donetsk must also be allowed to proceed unhindered.
Label: claim

Component: OSCE reports that UAVs are being jammed electronically by military- grade equipment call into question the credibility of the commitment towards the Minsk agreements of those who control that territory and their Russian supporters.
Label: premise

Component: The United Kingdom deeply regrets that illegal elections took place in separatist-controlled areas of Donetsk and Luhansk on 2 November.
Label: claim

Component: The Secretary- General could not have been clearer in his public message that the elections were illegal under Ukrainian law and seriously undermined the Minsk protocol.
Label: premise

Component: The Chairperson-in-Office of the OSCE was equally clear that the elections ran counter to the letter and spirit of the Minsk protocol and would further complicate its implementation.
Label: premise

Component: Russia's refusal to disavow the elections is a continuation of a pattern of Russian behaviour that flouts the Minsk agreements and is designed to destabilize the situation in Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: Although the focus of today's discussion is the increase in fighting and the illegal elections held in eastern Ukraine, the Council must not lose sight of the deteriorating human rights situation in areas under separatist control in eastern Ukraine and in particular in the illegally annexed Crimean peninsula, which the mission of the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights is still unable to visit.
Label: claim

Component: We continue to receive disturbing reports of intimidation and harassment of Crimean Tatars, ethnic Ukrainians and all those who have refused Russian citizenship.
Label: premise

Component: The de facto Crimean authorities have undertaken a campaign to rid the Crimean peninsula of its Ukrainian and Tatar identity.
Label: premise

Component: Citizenship provisions, the educational syllabus and the media are all being ruthlessly engineered to that end.
Label: premise

Component: Crimean Tatars are being targeted by security forces; 18 prominent Tatars remain missing and 1 body has been found.
Label: premise

Component: What we see is that Russia's actions continue to escalate tensions rather than contribute to a peaceful resolution of the crisis.
Label: claim

Component: Instead, Russia is taking a cynical and selective approach towards the agreements while it continues its destabilization of Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: That must change.
Label: claim

Component: We therefore call again on Russia to withdraw its equipment, weapons and troops from Ukrainian territory, as it undertook to do in September, and to use its influence to secure a lasting ceasefire.
Label: claim

Component: Its continued support for the armed separatists serves only to escalate an already perilous situation and will only lead to a further deterioration in Russia's relations with the international community.
Label: premise

Component: While the overall security situation in eastern Ukraine has been stable recently, violent attacks have continued to take place and have caused loss of life and property.
Label: premise

Component: At the same time, China welcomes the recent agreement signed between Russia and Ukraine on natural gas and hopes that the agreement will contribute to easing the current tensions and enhancing a political solution to the crisis in Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: China believes that a political solution is the only way to resolve the question of Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: Ukraine has rendered all necessary assistance to the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission in Ukraine to effectively implement its mandate.
Label: claim

Component: Russian-supported militants have not extended security guarantees to OSCE personnel in all areas that they control, and obstruct the Mission's monitoring activities.
Label: claim

Component: Moreover, in order to hide its violations, the Russian military uses cutting-edge electronic technology to jam OSCE drones, thereby disturbing monitoring efforts in the region in spite of the Minsk agreements.

Component: The Russian side has also refused tojoin the consensus on the proposed expansion of the mandate of the existing OSCE observation mission at two Russian border checkpoints to all Russian checkpoints along the 400-kilometre section of the border in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

Component: With the Mission's mandate set to expire on 23 November, we urge the Russian side to demonstrate a clear commitment to the peaceful resolution of the crisis in the eastern Ukraine by agreeing to allow OSCE observers to conduct their monitoring activities at all border crossings with Ukraine and along the entire length of the border in the area.

Component: Why is there such a stark difference in the approaches adopted by Ukraine and Russia to the role that the OSCE monitors can play in the current situation?

Component: Ukraine is open to transparent monitoring and control.

Component: Russia and its puppets are not.

Component: We agreed in Minsk to adopt the Ukrainian law on provisional arrangements for local government in some areas of Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts - the law on special status - and to ensure within the provisions of that law early local elections in some areas of Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts.
Label: premise

Component: The new law was adopted by the Ukrainian Parliament on 16 September.
Label: premise

Component: According to that law, local elections in some areas of Donetsk and Luhansk regions were scheduled for 7 December and were intended to produce legitimate local self- governance that would make proper use of enhanced powers, engage in an inclusive national dialogue and ensure the reconstruction of Donbas, which has been severely damaged by the military activities of illegal armed groups.
Label: premise

Component: Ukraine rejects any rumours about alleged additional agreements on this issue.

Component: What was agreed was signed and what was signed was published, including the OSCE press releases.

Component: These so-called elections were conducted in violation of Ukrainian legislation and international standards and contrary to the third and ninth articles of the Minsk protocol.

Component: By opting to recognize the illegal and illegitimate so-called elections in certain areas of Donbas
Label: premise

Component: Russia has chosen time and again to violate the norms of international law and fundamental OSCE principles and commitments.

Component: It has chosen to act in breach of the Minsk agreements.
Label: claim

Component: We are very concerned by the approach of the Russian Federation that consists in manipulating peoples' right to self-determination.
Label: premise

Component: Once again, it has, as we saw in Crimea, only one priority - to feed separatism and create frozen conflicts in sovereign States that Russia treats as zones of national interest.
Label: claim

Component: That is why neither Ukraine nor the international community will ever recognize the illegal referendum in Crimea or the illegal pseudo-elections in certain areas of the Donetsk and Lugansk regions, whatever their outcomes.
Label: claim

Component: Illegal elections and continuous violations of the ceasefire regime by militants, as well as a sharp increase in the illegal supply of weapons and military equipment across the border by the Russian Federation, have seriously undermined the Minsk process towards a peaceful settlement.
Label: claim

Component: They undermine any trust placed in signatories who fail to keep their word.
Label: claim

Component: Kyiv has confirmed its commitment to continuing to observe the ceasefire regime in line with the Minsk agreements, and called on all involved in the process to swiftly resume settlement efforts.

Component: We are seeking to make use of all possible mechanisms to forge a peaceful solution to the situation.

Component: We call on Russia, the European Union and the United States to meet together in the Geneva format in order to send a clear and consolidated message as well as strong impetus to the parties concerned to strictly adhere to the letter and spirit of the Minsk agreements.
