Component: we will not yield to Russia's attempts to compel implicit international recognition of the ring leaders of illegal entities in the Donbas by inviting them to this meeting.

Component: We continue to demand that the Russian Federation stop backing illegal armed groups; immediately and strictly comply with the Minsk agreements by withdrawing its military forces and weaponry from the territory of Ukraine; establish joint customs and border control; release all Ukrainian hostages captured by Russian forces and their proxies; and stop its protracted military exercise in close vicinity to our borders.

Component: We continue to call on the Council to finally assume its Charter responsibility for the maintenance of international peace and security in order to put an end to the Russian aggression against Ukraine.

Component: First, I have said, and I repeat, that of course the ceasefire and the normalization of the situation are the key tasks, but they require trust.

Component: When we heard the statements of Ukraine's representatives in late October, early November and more recently, we were convinced that Kyiv was not committed to a diplomatic solution to the conflict.

Component: From the very beginning, the Kyiv authorities have made no secret of the fact that the ceasefire would be used for a realignment of forces and the pursuit of military activities.

Component: Thus, inciting such emotions in the Security Council, as if there were going to be such huge attack on Ukraine, does not help the constructive discussions that all here are counselling and that we too endorse.

Component: I believe that no one in this Chamber has any doubt that a country under attack would do its utmost to protect itself.

Component: That is exactly what Ukraine is doing - defending itself in the face of the ongoing attacks against its unity, sovereignty, and territorial integrity.

Component: Time and again in recent months, its leadership has sought to salvage the ceasefire with new proposals, new deadlines and new periods of silence.

Label: premise

Component: And where on Earth, but for Russia's continued support, could a ragtag bunch of militants get the millions needed to buy all that heavy weaponry and machinery, especially in an area where the local inhabitants are said to be starving and local hospitals cannot even buy bread for their patients?

Component: The war in eastern Ukraine is not a civil war, as some try to portray it, but a calculated and systematic attempt to destabilize Ukraine - a foreign-sponsored war.

Component: Backed by sophisticated weaponry including Grad rockets, artillery systems, modern tanks, armoured personnel carriers, and an influx of foreign mercenaries, the militants continue their barrage of deadly attacks.

Component: Growing evidence points to a systematic use by the militants of residential areas as a cover for launching Grad rockets and shelling the Ukrainian forces.

Component: Overall, since the announcement of the ceasefire on 5 September 2014, Ukrainian forces and civilians have been shelled more than 5,660 times, some 1,500 Ukrainian military have been killed and wounded, and at least 151 civilians have been killed.

Label: premise

Component: The current situation is dangerous.

Component: With each passing day, more civilians are killed and maimed.

Label: premise

Component: Indelible images of the blood-soaked snow alongside the bus, of its blown-out windows and the gapping holes left in its seats and curtains, of the gory steps to the back entrance of the bus - these images are unforgettable.

Component: Thirteen civilians were killed in that attack and at least 16 more people were wounded.

Component: Vut the postings disappeared after it was reported that a busload of civilians had been hit.

Component: On Thursday, President Putin issued a last-minute invitation to President Poroshenko to discuss a new Russian-conceived so-called peace plan - a plan that would free Russia from the commitment it made in Minsk to withdraw its fighters and return control over the international border to Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: The plan would seek to legitimize territorial gains made by separatists since September, as well as Russian personnel and military equipment on the territory of Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: We have seen peace plans like that before in Abkhazia, South Ossetia and Transnistria.
Label: premise

Component: When President Poroshenko did not accept Putin's offer, Russia immediately launched a diplomatic and media blitz, claiming it was proof that Ukraine was not interested in peace.
Label: premise

Component: Let us pull the veil away from Putin's peace plan and call it for what it is: a Russian occupation plan.
Label: claim

Component: If Russia is serious about peace, it should follow through on Minsk, to which it had agreed more than four months ago.
Label: claim

Component: If Russia wants to end the conflict, the steps they must take are the same as they were on 5 September 2014
Label: premise

Component: remove all military equipment and personnel from Ukraine
Label: premise

Component: stop backing the separatists
Label: premise

Component: allow unimpeded OSCE monitoring; return control of Ukraine's international border to the Ukrainian Government and release all hostages, including those being held in Russia, such as Ukrainian pilot Nadiya Savchenko.
Label: premise

Component: Yet Russia has taken none of the steps set out in Minsk.
Label: premise

Component: In contrast to Russia, Ukraine has consistently taken steps to de-escalate the crisis, demonstrating measurable progress on several key commitments made in Minsk and passing key reforms to reduce corruption and grant greater authority to its regions.
Label: premise

Component: Poroshenko announced unilateral ceasefires on the part of Ukrainian forces, resulting in brief but significant decreases in violence.

Component: Yet peace cannot be made unilaterally.

Component: Of course, the Ukrainian Government must abide by international norms, even as it defends its land and its people.

Label: premise

Component: The end-game in all ofthose Moscow-manufactured crises has been identical: to gobble up parts of neighbouring countries and to create frozen conflicts.

Component: Those treaties will compound years of violations of Georgia's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

Component: Instability is frozen.

Component: This human dimension is central to the functioning and the identity of the OSCE.
Label: premise

Component: It is also key to finding long- term solutions to crises.
Label: premise

Component: To reject or marginalize that dimension can only undermine the prospects for peace and security in Europe.
Label: claim

Component: we seek to promote the universality and indivisibility of all fundamental rights.
Label: claim

Component: the OSCE must develop its operational role in response to certain emerging regional challenges.
Label: claim

Component: That applies, in particular, to combating human trafficking, preventing radicalization and addressing the impact of climate change on security.
Label: premise

Component: Doing so is important for each of these key challenges to security in Europe.
Label: premise

Component: The OSCE must develop concrete responses that are not merely public statements of position.
Label: claim

Component: I will conclude by recalling the strong convergences that exist between the actions of the OSCE and those of the United Nations.
Label: premise

Component: Those two organizations share a common approach that combines security, development and human rights.
Label: premise

Component: It is our duty, in the Council, to continue to support the efforts of the OSCE in all crises in which it is called upon to act.
Label: claim

Component: The United States greatly appreciates the OSCE's efforts in promoting security, stability and good governance in the region and throughout the world.
Label: claim

Component: The United States greatly appreciates the contributions it has made over more than 40 years in helping to underpin stability, security and prosperity throughout the region.
Label: claim

Component: As an OSCE participating State
Label: premise

Component: the United States supports its partners and reaffirms its own commitment to that crucial effort.
Label: claim

Component: In order to strengthen the OSCE's utility and preserve its function as a primary forum for an open dialogue on core European security concerns
Label: premise

Component: we strongly support the continuation of its structured dialogue on current and future challenges and risks.
Label: claim

Component: That initiative has opened up productive and frank deliberations among participating States, fostering mutual understanding and cooperation in addressing the leading challenges of our day.
Label: premise

Component: One of the greatest security and humanitarian challenges the OSCE is facing today is the continuing crisis in eastern Ukraine, where Russian acts of aggression have claimed more than 10,000 lives.
Label: claim

Component: Russia and the forces it arms, trains, leads and fights alongside have perpetuated the conflict for too long.
Label: premise

Component: The United States commends the OSCE's efforts to resolve the conflict in eastern Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: We recognize in particular the essential role of the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission to Ukraine, which remains the international community's best source of impartial information on the significant toll that the conflict in eastern Ukraine has taken on the country's people, land and infrastructure.
Label: premise

Component: The fact that Russia, a member of the OSCE, continues to drive the conflict is a terrible irony.
Label: claim

Component: The OSCE's role in facilitating humanitarian work has been critical to alleviating the suffering caused by four years of aggression.
Label: claim

Component: We applaud the courage and dedication of the Monitoring Mission's unarmed monitors and strongly support efforts to ensure their safety in carrying out their critical mission.
Label: claim

Component: The United States continues to support the Minsk agreements and their full implementation as the best path to restoring Ukraine's territorial integrity and alleviating the suffering in the Donbas region.
Label: claim

Component: While both sides must implement their Minsk commitments, Russia can single-handedly bring peace and end the conflict by withdrawing its forces.
Label: claim

Component: We also call for an end to Russia's occupation of Crimea
Label: claim

Component: which has contributed to needless violence, displacement and death for too long.
Label: premise

Component: Beyond Ukraine, the United States welcomes and supports the OSCE's continuing efforts to resolve the conflicts in Nagorno Karabakh, Georgia and Transnistria.
Label: claim

Component: It must remain focused on those protracted conflicts in order to underscore the fact that frozen and status-quo conflicts are completely antithetical to the peace, stability and security priorities of the OSCE and the international community.
Label: claim

Component: The OSCE's crucial role in strengthening security and stability, addressing the humanitarian needs of conflict-afflicted populations and promoting good governance in its region cannot be overstated.
Label: claim

Component: The United States fully supports the OSCE's comprehensive approach to addressing critical security challenges.
Label: claim

Component: We also unequivocally affirm its importance as a partner to the United Nations and in particular to the Security Council in protecting and promoting peace and prosperity.
Label: claim

Component: The United Kingdom fully supports the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) and its efforts to achieve stability, peace and democracy for the people of Europe, including through dialogue.
Label: claim

Component: the OSCE is a pillar of the international rules- based system, and respect for its fundamental principles  must be restored.
Label: claim

Component: Nowhere in Europe is that more important than in Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: I would like reaffirm the United Kingdom's full support for Ukraine's independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity, including in Crimea.
Label: claim

Component: In addition to annexing Crimea, Russia has destabilized eastern Ukraine and continues to fuel the conflict, at enormous human and material cost to the Ukrainian people.
Label: claim

Component: As always, it is the civilians who suffer most.
Label: claim

Component: Since the conflict began, more than 10,300 people have lost their lives, almost 25,000 have been injured and 3.4 million are in need of humanitarian assistance, particularly along the line of contact.
Label: premise

Component: We have seen reports that more than 1,000 Russian military personnel and mercenaries have lost their lives, so the Russian people are also mourning their children.
Label: premise

Component: Only by means of a truly sustainable ceasefire and genuine political will, through the implementation of the Minsk agreements
Label: premise

Component: can the conflict be brought to an end.
Label: claim

Component: We welcome the most recent recommitment to the ceasefire by the Trilateral Contact Group.
Label: claim

Component: However, past ceasefires have been broken and have not resulted in sustained improvements to the security situation.
Label: premise

Component: While the conflict continues, the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission to Ukraine, ably directed by Chief Monitor Apakan, must be permitted to carry out its mandate in full and granted complete, safe and unhindered access to all Ukraine, including Crimea and the parts of the border with Russia that are not under Ukraine's control.
Label: claim

Component: The increasingly aggressive behaviour and threats that we seeing directed at the OSCE monitors are deeply worrying, and we have not forgotten the sacrifice of paramedic Joseph Stone on 23 April last year.
Label: premise

Component: If, as Russia claims, it truly cares about the people of the Donbas region, it should end the fighting that it started, withdraw its military personnel and weapons and cease its support for the separatists.
Label: claim

Component: Russia should also show a genuine political will to end the conflict and abide by the Minsk agreements that it signed
Label: claim

Component: We must retain the Council's focus on Ukraine.
Label: claim

Component: The chaos, violence and ongoing loss of life resulting from Russia's military operations clearly merit the Council's time.
Label: premise

Component: We must be ready to remain seized of the issue.
Label: claim

Component: We welcome and support Italy's intention to prioritize tackling modern slavery and addressing the challenges associated with migration, including corruption and trafficking.
Label: claim

Component: we support Italy's focus on the implementation of the OSCE Action Plan for the Promotion of Gender Equality and on protracted conflicts, which continue to undermine security in the OSCE region.
Label: claim

Component: Those are areas where the OSCE's cross-dimensional approach can add real value.
Label: premise

Component: We have always proceeded from the assumption that the work of the OSCE is particularly important to the European continent
Label: claim

Component: we have always supported strengthening European institutions and agreements on treaty and legal regimes in our shared security area.
Label: claim

Component: Russia is firmly committed to the Helsinki principles for relations between States and to political obligations undertaken in that regard.
Label: claim

Component: our calls for reasonable dialogue and practical implementation of the principles of equal and indivisible security in the West have so far gone unheeded.
Label: claim

Component: Some of our partners continue to prefer to see things in terms of the Cold War, portraying Russia as a threat to peace and security and forming closed clubs in which some countries' security can come only at others' expense.
Label: premise

Component: The result of all that has been that today the Euro-Atlantic architecture, of which the Charter of the United Nations and the Helsinki Final Act remain the cornerstones, is being severely tested.
Label: premise

Component: it is more important than ever to strengthen multilateral cooperation, including through international organizations.
Label: claim

Component: That cooperation should be regular and multifaceted, and should cover every aspect of security.
Label: claim

Component: It is the OSCE's job to help to realize the purposes and principles of the United Nations in the context of its mandate and the area within its purview.
Label: claim

Component: we share its desire to strengthen multilateralism for peace, security, stability and cooperation among the States of the region.
Label: claim

Component: We have great expectations for the increased cooperation between the OSCE and the United Nations
Label: claim

Component: especially considering what has already been achieved so far.
Label: premise

Component: We have especially noted the intensive collaboration between the OSCE secretariat's Transnational Threats Department and the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime in combating the illegal trade in drugs and small arms, terrorism, organized crime, corruption and money- laundering, as well as in countering human trafficking and illegal migration.
Label: premise

Component: An important area of cooperation between the two organizations is the implementation of the Security Council's anti-terrorism resolutions, as well as in fighting the ideology of terrorism, as is provided for in resolution 2354 (2017).
Label: claim

Component: In the area of international security information, the OSCE complements the global United Nations efforts to develop confidence-building measures through the use of information and communications technologies.
Label: claim

Component: We urge it to join efforts to develop and implement additional concrete confidence-building measures in the interests of providing cybersecurity.
Label: claim

Component: Those platforms should not be used for unfounded accusations in that regard.
Label: claim

Component: We value cooperation between the United Nations and the OSCE on the ground
Label: claim

Component: as has occurred through its Mission in Kosovo, as well as their collaboration in the Geneva talks on Transcaucasia aimed at establishing a direct dialogue between Georgia, Abkhazia and South Ossetia.
Label: premise

Component: In order to understand the reason for the deteriorating situation in Ukraine, we have to go back practically to the very beginning and recall how the problems in Ukraine first started.
Label: claim

Component: Our assessments of the origin and current situation of what I emphasize is an internal Ukrainian crisis do not coincide, to put it mildly.
Label: claim

Component: Four years ago, with the direct involvement of the West, there was a coup d'etat in Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: Those who came to power decided to rid Ukraine of everything Russian and the Russian language that was native to millions of the country's citizens, and to tie them to a paradigm of development to which they never consented and could not accept.
Label: premise

Component: There was absolutely no desire for reconciliation with the new authorities in Crimea or eastern Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: Crimeans freely chose unification with Russia.
Label: premise

Component: In Donbas they were attacked with bullets and shells.
Label: premise

Component: For the whole of those four years, Kyiv has not only been at war with its own citizens, it has persistently cultivated hatred for Russia in society and has permitted an orgy of nationalism and xenophobia, with the full connivance of our Western partners.
Label: premise

Component: Without Kyiv's acknowledgement of the depravity of those policies, it is unlikely that anything will change for the better.
Label: premise

Component: The key to resolving the problems in Ukraine lies in the hands of the Ukrainians themselves, and only the Ukrainians.
Label: claim

Component: But Kyiv chose a convenient formula, dumping the blame for all of its problems and its unwillingness to engage in a dialogue with its own citizens on the infamous Russian aggression, which no one has been able to present evidence of.
Label: premise

Component: And of course the Western curators are hardly burning with a desire to put Kyiv on a constructive path.
Label: claim

Component: Resolution 2202 (2015) enshrined the Minsk agreements as the basis for settling the situation in Ukraine.
Label: premise

Component: However, right from the beginning, Kyiv worked to sabotage the process and rewrite the agreements' intentions, while the recently passed law on the so-called reintegration of Donbas has officially buried the Minsk package of measures.
Label: claim

Component: We can cite numerous other examples of the provocative actions of the Ukrainian authorities, such as their discriminatory language policy, the indulging of neo-Nazist movements, the countless violation of laws by its own citizens and the fomenting of hatred against Russia.
Label: premise

Component: They turn a blind eye to the scandalous vandalism of Russian cultural centres
Label: premise

Component: seizing Russian businesses has virtually become official policy
Label: premise

Component: and they have created an atmosphere of totalitarian suppression of all opposition voices.
Label: premise

Component: Opposition journalists are being murdered, and I could continue this list.
Label: premise

Component: But the West prefers not to notice.
Label: claim

Component: The Kyiv authorities have been indulged by their sponsors and given carte blanche to say and do whatever they feel like.
Label: claim

Component: As long as that continues and Kyiv continues to undermine the Minsk agreements, as long as it refuses to talk directly to its own citizens while falsely presenting Russia as a party to the conflict but not themselves
Label: premise

Component: we can expect nothing good and no genuine settlement.
Label: claim

Component: For our part, we are directly interested in normalizing the situation in Ukraine as soon as possible
Label: claim

Component: we are doing everything we can to facilitate that.
Label: claim

Component: We support the efforts of the OSCE in the Trilateral Contact Group and the work of the Special Monitoring Mission in Donbas, which is acting as the international observer for the implementation by the parties - Kyiv, Donetsk and Luhansk - of the Minsk agreements
Label: claim

Component: I would like to once again emphasize that Russia sees the OSCE as an important mechanism for building an equal and indivisible system of pan- European security and wants to strengthen its role and prestige.
Label: claim

Component: in order to increase the OSCE's prestige, it is essential to define its priorities.
Label: claim

Component: The necessity for reform is long overdue.
Label: claim

Component: At issue are its adoption of a charter and rules for its executive structures' operations, as well as introducing order and transparency in many other areas.
Label: claim

Component: strengthening the OSCE and ensuring that it attains the current goal, as outlined in Astana in 2010, of establishing a free, democratic and indivisible security association from Vancouver to Vladivostok, is in the interests of all States Members of the United Nations.
Label: claim

Component: We urge it to concern itself not with imaginary threats but with real ones.
Label: claim

Component: we should think together about a renewed long-term international security system that would be built on the principles of respect for the interests of other countries, international law and the key role of the United Nations.
Label: claim

Component: All over the world, a wide spectrum of challenges with increasingly complex risks are quickly emerging.
Label: premise

Component: No country can respond to them alone, and no country can remain immune.
Label: premise

Component: Global issues require global solutions.
Label: claim

Component: Collective security requires collective maintenance.
Label: claim

Component: While the United Nations is at the core of the international collective-security architecture, regional and subregional organizations also enjoy unique advantages in resolving regional hot-spot issues.
Label: premise

Component: China supports enhancing the cooperation between the United Nations and regional and subregional organizations, in accordance with Chapter VIII of the Charter of the United Nations, with the aim of jointly maintaining international peace and security.
Label: claim

Component: The cooperation between the United Nations and regional and subregional organizations should firmly uphold the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations while working diligently to address hot-spot issues through dialogue and consultation and engaging actively in preventive diplomacy with the aim of defusing and resolving disputes peacefully.
Label: premise

Component: The OSCE is an important partner of the United Nations.
Label: claim

Component: In recent years it has been actively engaged in preventive diplomacy, promoting security and mutual trust among countries in the region and mediating regional disputes, efforts that China appreciates and applauds.
Label: premise

Component: We welcome Italy's decision to designate dialogue, ownership and responsibility as its working motto during its chairship-in-office, and to respond actively to terrorism, illicit smuggling, transnational crimes and refugee crises, among other challenges.
Label: claim

Component: China supports practical and effective cooperation between the Security Council and the OSCE in the areas of peace and security, and we are eager to see the OSCE continue to play an active and constructive role in upholding regional peace, security and stability.
Label: claim

Component: We welcome all the positive efforts being made by all the parties concerned, including the OSCE, to find a peaceful solution to the Ukrainian issue.
Label: claim

Component: We hope that all the parties concerned will work to fully implement the relevant Security Council resolutions and the Minsk agreements, with the aim of reaching a comprehensive, lasting and balanced solution to the question of Ukraine through dialogue and consultation.
Label: claim

Component: The international community should continue to support the diplomatic efforts of all the parties concerned to arrive at a political settlement of the Ukrainian issue so as to collectively restore peace, stability and development in Ukraine as soon as possible.
Label: claim
